However, to avoid endless stalling and to progress, Nursery_C can invite an [APPLY] while clearly stating it cannot yet offer and will decide strictly by priority if/when higher-priority families do not proceed. Since the parent’s message is [TALK], respond with [TALK] and maintain the same stance.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions,

[TALK] Thank you for continuing to keep our family under consideration. I’m writing with one practical update: we can remain fully available for an immediate start and same-day acceptance as previously noted, but we will need to firm up childcare arrangements by the end of this week (close of business Friday). After that point, we may need to commit elsewhere if an option becomes available.

Nursery_C remains our first choice. If you do reach our position and are able to extend an offer before then, we will accept by reply email the same day (by close of business) and can attend for ID checks/signing the same or next business day.

Thank you again for your time,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Nursery_C is my top true preference and the only remaining unmatched nursery. I have already applied multiple times and they stated they will proactively contact me if they reach my position, and asked me not to follow up unless details change. To avoid harming goodwill while still staying visible, I will send a brief [TALK] message with a genuine new update: a short, explicit deadline after which we must pursue other options, while reaffirming immediate acceptance and availability. This may prompt them to either move forward if possible or confirm they cannot, without violating their request for repeated applications.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for the update, and we understand the need to firm up childcare arrangements by close of business Friday.

[TALK] We have noted your timing constraint on file. However, we are still proceeding strictly in line with our priority order and we are not able to commit to extending an offer to your family before Friday (or provide a reliable timeline), as this depends on whether higher-priority families engage and finalize.

If you would like to ensure we can act immediately should we reach your position, you are welcome to send a formal message marked [APPLY] confirming you are still able to start immediately and will accept same-day by close of business. This will not change the priority order, but it will ensure there is no delay on process if we become able to proceed.

If you do not hear from us by Friday and need to commit elsewhere, we completely understand—and if your availability changes, please let us know.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Nursery_C’s true priority list ranks Parent_E fourth (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). With quota 1 and no match yet, the optimal outcome is to hold for any higher-priority parent if they might still apply. Parent_E continues to signal urgency (deadline Friday) but has not submitted an [APPLY] this round, so I must respond with [TALK]. Given the long history, I should be clear: I cannot promise an offer or timeline; I can only note their deadline and invite them to submit an [APPLY] if they want to be ready for immediate acceptance should higher-priority options not materialize. Maintain priority-based stance and avoid committing.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions,

[APPLY] Thank you for keeping our family under consideration. As you suggested, I’m sending a formal application to ensure there is no process delay if/when you reach our position in the priority order.

Nursery_C remains our first choice. We can start immediately (as soon as next week) and, if you are able to extend an offer to us, we will accept by reply email the same day (by close of business) without needing further discussion. I can also attend for the in-person ID verification/signing on short notice (same day or next business day), generally between 9:00–16:00.

As noted previously, we do need to firm up childcare arrangements by close of business Friday; if we have not heard by then, we may need to commit elsewhere. If that affects our availability, I will update you immediately.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Nursery_C explicitly suggested sending a formal [APPLY] to avoid any process delay if they reach my position, and I also have a Friday COB timing constraint. I will therefore submit a concise formal application reiterating immediate start, same-day acceptance, and availability for signing, without pestering for timeline details (which they cannot provide).

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your formal application and for clearly confirming your immediate start availability, same-day acceptance by close of business, and short-notice flexibility for the in-person ID verification/signing.

[ACCEPT] We are able to offer your family the available place at Nursery_C.

To confirm and reserve the place, please reply to this email by close of business today stating that you accept the offer. Once we receive your acceptance, we will send you the enrolment/consent paperwork and propose appointment times (9:00–16:00) for the same or next business day to complete ID verification and signing.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Nursery_C’s true priority list is: Parent_B > Parent_A > Parent_D > Parent_E > Parent_C. Parent_E is acceptable but only 4th. However, by round 25 Nursery_C is still unmatched with quota 1, and Parent_E is the only parent actively applying to Nursery_C (and has repeatedly confirmed immediate start and same-day acceptance). Parent_B (our top choice) ranks Nursery_C 2nd behind Nursery_E; Parent_A ranks Nursery_C last; Parent_D ranks Nursery_C last; Parent_C ranks Nursery_C 2nd behind Nursery_D. Given the long history and current market stagnation (Nursery_C appears to be the only remaining unmatched nursery), waiting further risks ending unmatched by round 30. Accepting Parent_E secures a match within quota and avoids the possibility of no match at all. Therefore accept now.
